user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_generic_dev_dma_map:
```c
int metal_generic_dev_dma_map(struct metal_bus *bus,
			     struct metal_device *device,
			     uint32_t dir,
			     struct metal_sg *sg_in,
			     int nents_in,
			     struct metal_sg *sg_out)
{
	int i;
	(void)bus;
	(void)device;

	if (sg_out != sg_in)
		memcpy(sg_out, sg_in, nents_in*(sizeof(struct metal_sg)));
	for (i = 0; i < nents_in; i++) {
		if (dir == METAL_DMA_DEV_W) {
			metal_cache_flush(sg_out[i].virt, sg_out[i].len);
		}
		metal_cache_invalidate(sg_out[i].virt, sg_out[i].len);
	}

	return nents_in;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code fragment. Specifically:
- There are no vendor-specific keywords or builtins (for example, __attribute__, __asm, __builtin_*, typeof, __int128, statement-expression ({ ... }), nested functions, labels-as-values, or other known GCC/Clang/MSVC extensions).
- No inline assembly or #pragma vendor-specific directives are present.
- The cast-to-void idiom for unused parameters, use of standard types (uint32_t), standard library function memcpy, and sizeof on a struct are all standard C constructs, not extensions.
- All control structures and declarations shown conform to standard C syntax.

Note: The functions metal_cache_flush and metal_cache_invalidate are called but their declarations are not in this fragment; if their declarations use compiler-specific extensions that would need to be reviewed, but those declarations are outside the provided code and thus not flagged here.
